Did you know? This year, U Prep Schools commemorates our 20th anniversary.

In 1999, Robert (Bob) and Ellen Thompson formed the Thompson Foundation. With a passion focused on creating educational opportunities for Detroit youth, in 2000, the Thompsons funded the construction of the first of nine buildings, which is now the largest charter school network in the City of Detroit, U Prep Schools.

Twenty years later, as a ten-school K-12 charter school network in the heart of the city, U Prep Schools remains committed to academic excellence. We are dedicated to providing a culturally responsive educational experience that builds academic competence, habits of work, scholarship, and self-actualization, that empowers scholars to successfully accomplish their post-secondary plans, and allows our students to advance as change agents for their community.

Learn more about U Prep at https://buff.ly/34kCDbh

shared_text:
Wayne State University College of Education
March 10 at 3:51 PM ¬∑

How sweet it is! Or is it? In ‚ÄúSugar Shock,‚Äù representatives from Building Healthy Communities taught students from University Prep Science and Math Middle School all about sugar: what it is, where it is found, and different types and how they are digested in the body. Students investigated what ‚Äúadded sugar‚Äù means and what happens to the body when it gets too much of it. Then, students put their new knowledge to the test by examining food labels and calculating sugar content using sugar cubes. In many cases, they were shocked to discover how much sugar is in the snacks, foods, and drinks they consume. Finally, students got to sample tropical and berry smoothies. Sweeeeet!

#WSUSTEM #WayneStateCOE Wayne State University Kinesiology, Health, & Sport Studies University Prep Schools
